title: BATTLE HYMN OF THE REPUBLIC
content:
Mine eyes have seen the glory of the coming of the Lord.

He is tramping our the vintage where the grapes of wrath are stored

He hath loosed the fateful lightening of His terrible swift sword;

His truth is marching on.

Chorus: Glory, Glory, Halleluya

Glory, Glory, Halleluya

Glory, Glory, Halleluya

His truth is marching on.

2. I have seen him in the watch fires or a hundred circling camps; They have builded Him an alter in the evening dews and damps I can read his righteous sentence by the dim and flaring lamps; His day is marching on. (His day is marching on).

3. He has sounded forth the trumpet that shall never sound retreat; He is sifting out the hearts of men before his judgement seat O be swift, my soul to answer Him, be jubilant, my feet Our God is marching on (our God is marching on).

4. In the beauty of the lilies Christ was born across the sea With a glory in His bosom that transfigures you and me.As He died to make men holy, let us die to make men free tWhile God is marching on (while God is marching on)

title: ADUPE
content:

2. Oba ti o dawa si ninu ewu gbogbo oba to pawamo ninu ewu, ninu ewu oru ogoiyin loye o loye o ogo iyin loye fun Oluwa.

And hail Him as thy match – less king Thro’ all e-ter-nity.

2. Crown Him the Lord of life! Who tri-umphed o’er the grave

Who rose vic-to rious to the strife for those He came to save

His glories now we sing, who died and rose on high

Who died eternal life to bring and lives that death may die.

3. Ede L’ ade pupo Od’aguntan Baba: Gbo bi orin orun ti bo orin gbogbo mole;

Ji okan mi korin T’ eni t’ okun fun o, se l’ oba re to ga julo Titi ati laelae;

To thee be end – less praise for thou, for us has died!

Be thou, o Lord, thro’ end – less days A- dored and magni-f-ied.

title: THE OLD RUGGED CROSS
content:
One shill far away stood an old rugged cross

The emblem of suffering and shame

And I love that old cross where the dearest and best for a world of lost sinners was slain.

Chorus: So I’ will cherish the old rugged cross

Till my trophies at last I lay down,

I will cling to the old rugged cross

And exchange it some day for a crown.

2. Oh, that old rugged cross so despised by the world

Has a wonderous attraction for me;

For the dear lamb of God left His Glory above

To bear it to dark calvary.

3. In the old rugged cross, stained with blood so divine

A wondrous beauty I see;

For ‘t was on that old cross Jesus suffered and dired to pardon and sanctify me.

4. To the old rugged cross I will ever be true its shame and reproach gladly bear;

Then he ‘ll call me some day to my home for away,

Where his glory for ever I ‘ll share.

title: WHERE SHALL I BE?
content:
1. Where shall I be when judgement day is drawing near, where shalli be?

When God the works of men shall try, where shall I be?

When east and west in the fire shall roll, where shall I be?

How will it be with my poor soul, where shall I be?

Refrain: where shall I be when the frist trum-pet sounds?

Where it sound so loud as to wake up the dead?

Oh where shall I be when it sounds?

2. When wicked men is wrought shall see, where shall I be?

And to the rock and mountain flees where shall I be?

And hills and mountain flees away where shall I be?

And all the work of men decay where shall I be?

3. When heaven and earth and some great rolls, where shall I be?

Shall from God’s angry presence roll where shall I be?

When all the saints redeemed shall stand where shall I be?

Wherever bless at God’s right hand, where shall I be?

title: ORO IFE
content:
Prelude: Oro ife ni/3x ife ni/2x

Eniyan meji ha le rin po laise pe won re

Oro ife ni- ife ni/2x

Oro ife o- kinni la o ba fi we ninu ile-oro ife o kila o ba fi we laarin oko ataya – seye gbo- gbo o, oro ife o lemi ni ki a ba yin so – o dabi afefe ninu boolu, boolu afowogba –

Ani bi afeefe ninu boolu afesegba, boolu kole rin lai ni afefe ninu, afeefe o accelerator ni a o ba pe beeni oro ife je ninu ile/laarin oko ataya.

Oro ife- ife loso yin po ti e fi pinnu lati jumo ma gbe, laisi ife o iru eto yi ko le waye – ina ife yen o ko ma gbodo ku are, ina ife yin o eje ko ma jo titi lai. Boya be o ba gba pelu mi un o ba so wipe bi ounje fun are beeni ife je fun ile – bojo se ngori ojo beeni ome eniyan njeun si (beniyan ba tin je si be lagbara npo si be lo se ye kori fun ilera idile yin/kife yin ko ma po si/2x

Ololufe oni eteti – ife pipe nle beru lo, ife a ma mu suru, a ma seun kii se ilara rara, kiife ki igberaga, ki iwa ohun tara re, kii gbiro buburu ki ihuwa aito, ama yo ninu otito, ife lo n bo ese mole ki yoo si aiseododo – (se eti gbo) a ma farada ohun gbogbo, a ma gbahun gbogbo gbo, a ma reti ohun gbogbo, ama fayaran ohun gbogbo – ise ife po ninu idile – ise ife ga o, ife o ni ki e fi ma sohun gbogbo.

Bogiri o lanu alangba ko ma le wole – e mase fun esu laaye awon eniyan bi esu e fi sokan le won jinna – e ko lati ma bowo funra yin- e bola fun ara yin o ni iberu Oluwa.

Ire, ire ko ma je ti yin, kolorun ko gbeyin roo loruko Jesu

Ninu ile, lona ajo, nibi ise lojo gbogbo ire, ire ko ma ……………………..

E o nib o sowo ota, aye ko nip on yin loku ……………………………………

Ire owo, ire omo, ire emi gigun - ire ire ………………………………

Loruko jesu ire anu olorun ko ma ba yin gbe ……………………………

title: GOOD CHRISTIAN MEN REJOICE
content:
1. Good Christian men, rejoice

With heart and soul and voice

Give ye heed to what we say

News! News! Jesus Christ wa born today

Ox an ass before him bow

And he is in the manager now

Christ is born today! Chirst is born today

2. Good Christan men, rejoice

With hear and soul and voice

Now ye hear of endless bliss

Joy! Joy! Jesus Christ was born for this

He hat opened the heavenly door

And man is blessed for evermore

Christ was born for this: Christ was born for this.

3. Good Christian men, rejoice

With heart, soul and voice

Now ye need not fear the grave

Peace! Peace! Jesus Christ was born to save!

To gain His evalasting hall

Christ was born to save! Christ wa born to save!

title: JOY TO THE WORLD
content:
1. Joy to the world: the Lord is come:

Let earth receive her king

Let ev’ry heart prepare His room

And heav’n and nature sing/2x

And heav’n /2x and nature sing.

2. Joy to the world: the Saviour reigns

Let men, their songs employ,

While fields and floods, rocks, hills

And plains (repeat sounding joy)2x

Repeat/2x repeat the sounding joy.

3. No more let sins and sorrows grow

Nor thorns infest the ground;

He come to make his blessings flow

Far as the curse ins found/2x

Far as/2x the curse is found.

4. He rules the world with truth and grace, and makes the nations prove

The glories of his righteousness,

And wonders of his love/2x

And wonders/2x of his love.
